intro: Mikania palmata, commonly known as the palmate morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Mikania palmata is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
